content.question: Two students, <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, sit on a seesaw that is in static equilibrium, as shown in the figure. A fulcrum is located at the center of the seesaw. The mass <math alttext="m sub Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of Student <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is known. A third student, <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, must determine the mass of Student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following measurements should Student <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> make in order to determine the mass of Student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>? Justify your selection.

choices.label: The length of the seesaw, because the entire length of the seesaw is in static equilibrium.

The distance that Student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is from the edge of the seesaw and the distance that Student <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is from the edge of the seesaw, because the seesaw would no longer be in static equilibrium if one or both students moved closer to the edge of the seesaw.

The distance that Student <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is from the center of the seesaw and the distance that Student <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is from the center of the seesaw, because these are the distances from the fulcrum to the location of the forces exerted on the two-student-seesaw system.
The mass of the seesaw, because a force due to gravity is exerted on the seesaw from Earth.
